title: Showery conditions expected to enhance from tomorrow
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance located to the east of Sri Lanka continues to influence the island’s weather, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: UN Security Council to meet Monday over US action in Venezuela
byline: The United Nations Security Council is due to meet on Monday after the U.S. attacked Venezuela and deposed its long-serving autocratic President Nicolas Maduro, a move that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres views as setting “a dangerous precedent.”

title: Four suspects arrested over shooting incident in Kohuwala
byline: Four suspects have been arrested in connection with the attempted murder incident reported in the Bodhiyawatta area, Saranankara Road, Kohuwala.

title: Former Sathosa Transport Manager arrested by FCID
byline: The Former Transport Manager of Sathosa, Indika Ratnamalala, has been arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) in connection with allegations over the misuse of a Sathosa-owned lorry, police said.

title: Venezuela’s Supreme Court orders Delcy Rodriguez become interim president
byline: The Constitutional Chamber of Venezuela’s Supreme Court ordered on Saturday that Vice President Delcy Rodríguez assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolás Maduro, who was detained early Saturday morning in an operation by U.S. forces.

title: Five including 02 youths, woman killed in separate road accidents yesterday
byline: Five people, including two youths and a woman, have lost their lives in several road accidents reported from different areas within the past 24 hours.

title: SPMC plans to introduce 10 new pharmaceutical products this year
byline: The State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation (SPMC) of Sri Lanka says it plans to introduce 10 new pharmaceutical products to the market this year.

title: All schools to commence for 2026 academic year tomorrow
byline: All schools are scheduled to commence the first phase of the first term of the 2026 academic year from tomorrow (05).

title: SAARC Journalists Forum from today in Nalanda University, India
byline: A two-day international conference will be held in Nalanda on January 4-5, 2026, under the aegis of the SAARC Journalists Forum India Chapter Bihar, Nalanda Open University, and Human Rights Today.

title: US airstrikes in Venezuela leave at least 40 dead, including civilians and soldiers: reports
byline: At least 40 people, including civilians and soldiers, were reportedly killed in the US military action in Venezuela on Saturday, during which Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was captured.

title: Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation records highest-ever annual revenue
byline: The Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation has recorded its highest-ever annual revenue, earning Rs. 168 million during the year 2025, marking a historic milestone since the establishment of the corporation.

title: Minister accuses wildlife officials of inaction over wild elephants
byline: Minister of Public Administration Chandana Abeyratne has accused wildlife officers of failing to take necessary action to drive away wild elephants entering villages.

title: Four including woman arrested with ‘Ice’ in Peliyagoda and Grandpass
byline: Four individuals, including a woman, have been arrested in possession of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) following a series of police raids in the Peliyagoda and Grandpass areas.

title: Female airline crew member arrested over gold smuggling attempt at BIA
byline: A female crew member of a private airline has been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs officers for attempting to illegally smuggle a consignment of gold jewellery and gold biscuits worth over Rs. 40 million into the country.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink to provide free internet services in Venezuela through February 3
byline: Billionaire Elon Musk on Sunday expressed support for the people of Venezuela as SpaceX-owned Starlink announced it was providing free broadband internet services in the country for a limited period, as Venezuela remains gripped by fast-moving political developments.

title: Former Sathosa Transport Manager arrested by FCID remanded
byline: Former Transport Manager of Lanka Sathosa, Indika Ratnamalala, who was arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) in connection with allegations over the misuse of a Sathosa-owned lorry, has been remanded.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles as rival South’s leader visits China
byline: North Korea launched ballistic missiles on Sunday, the day the leader of rival South Korea starts a state visit to China, Pyongyang’s chief ally, and just hours after the U.S. attacked Venezuela.

title: JVP condemns US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro
byline: The JVP has issued a statement following the attacks carried out by the United States in Venezuela and the move to take Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife into US custody.

title: Health Ministry delays enforcement of several Food Act regulations
byline: The Ministry of Health has taken steps to postpone the date of implementation of several regulations issued under Section 32 of Sri Lanka’s Food Act.

title: Sanath Jayasuriya to step down as Sri Lanka Head Coach after T20 World Cup
byline: Sri Lanka National Cricket Team Head Coach Sanath Jayasuriya says he has decided to step down from his position following the upcoming ICC Men’s T20 World Cup.

title: “Deep Concern”: India’s message to people of Venezuela after US raid
byline: India today said the developments in Venezuela are a matter of deep concern and it is closely monitoring the evolving situation, a day after US special forces captured President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores from the capital Caracas in a textbook nighttime airborne raid.

title: Action to be taken based on report of internal committee appointed to probe questionable Grade 6 Module contents
byline: The internal committee appointed to look into the questionable Grade 6 Module contents has submitted its report & necessary action will be taken regarding the issue -Minister Vijitha Herath.

title: Bill to repeal Parliamentary Pensions Act gazetted
byline: The Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) bill has been gazetted to repeal the Parliamentary Pensions Act, No. 1 of 1977.

title: Suspect arrested for stealing foreign journalist’s handbag
byline: An individual has been arrested in connection with the theft of a handbag containing a valuable mobile phone, bank cards, and cash belonging to an Australian journalist.

title: Indian Army Chief to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Indian Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on January 07, the Indian Defence Ministry has announced.

title: Sri Lanka urges respect for national sovereignty in line with UN Charter
byline: It is essential to act in a manner that safeguards a country’s sovereignty in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations and international law, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath stated when questioned over the attacks carried out by the United States in Venezuela and the capture of President Nicolás Maduro.

title: ‘Deeply shocked’: World leaders react to US attack on Venezuela
byline: Leaders around the world have responded with a mix of condemnation and support to the US capture of Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Education reforms will go ahead as planned, new curriculum for Grade 6 from Jan. 21, PM Harini confirms
byline: The proposed education reforms will go ahead as planned, the Minister of Education Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has confirmed.

title: Dilith vows to support President if he makes ‘bold stand’ against US military action in Venezuela
byline: The Leader of Sarvajana Balaya, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera is of the view that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will object to Washington’s move to capture Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro in a military operation early on Saturday morning (03).

title: Clarification issued on fake ‘Police Notice’ circulating online
byline: A message currently circulating on social media and messaging platforms, titled as a “Police Notice” and containing a list of safety instructions, has not been issued by Sri Lanka Police, the Police headquarters has stated.

title: Thousands stranded across Europe as Greece airspace disrupted
byline: Thousands of passengers are stranded across Europe after a communications failure forced Greece to close its airspace, causing widespread cancellations and delays.

title: China calls on US to release Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife at once
byline: China called on the United States to release Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife at once, said a Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson on Sunday.

title: Ex- Minister Johnston Fernando instructed to appear before FCID tomorrow
byline: Police have informed that former Minister Johnston Fernando has been instructed to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) tomorrow (05), and that if he fails to do so, a warrant will be obtained from court to arrest him.

title: Showery condition in several provinces to enhance from tomorrow
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance located to the east of Sri Lanka will continue to influence the weather patterns in the country, the Department of Meteorology stated.
